text: I'm on the streetcar today, so if I'm a bit late, that's why

<@U02F8TTPU>: The official immersion request is to hide to the About/Legal buttons (they won't have official copy ready). To leave them in so that they can re-implemented down the road -- but not be accessible for CES. Cool?
Marissa and I just chatted. She's commenting out the about/legal buttons, and expanding the menu buttons to fill the the leftover space.
cool
Also, I'm going to make the "selected" state for the pressable menu items a darker color variant of the current colors.
fitness band selected is #9f4526
smartwatch selected is #a48423
sportwatch selected is #007781
index selected is #24313f
let me know if any of those should be changed, I'm pretty basic at picking colors :simple_smile:
I think that should all be fine (independent of seeing it on device). If they're darker, that sounds great

<@U02F8TTPU> Found it. In Dave's spreadsheet feedback he requested an affordance be added to the splash screen to get into the demo â€” potentially an arrow to the right and GO. We responded in our following build (friday) with an update that moved the about/legal to the main nav to make room for this affordance, and added the simple downward facing arrow to the splash screen.
yay! good find :simple_smile:
I've got all the color press states and the idle timeout working, so I'm making progress on the goal achieved animation now
awesome!
Yeeeeeah!
Got the animation! I was a little bit lazy (I'm animating the stars all together instead of each one separately) but I think it looks quite reasonable.
boom. i trust it looks incredible.
All right, I just pushed the merge and commented on today's basecamp thread to confirm. I'll also take the Gear S home with me and see if I can make some improvements over the holiday.
soliddddd

I have a suspicion that scrolling is just fine -- it behaves well for the most part in my testing, and I suspect Immersion hasn't tested recent builds very much. If they push on that issue, I'll look into it more, but I think first I'll redo the clock demos to be a single page with its own navigation logic.
It doesn't get much more 11th hour than Dave B's feedback. <@U02F8TTPU>, what are the issues he logged in gitlab?
Ugh, I'm on my phone right now and won't be back home until late, but I'll check it tomorrow morning and pass along the info.
No problem. Check when you can and let's make a plan in the morning. A plan that's primarily motive is to not mess up your new years.
